summary: Web application "SHQ Principal Daily Performance Tracker" to capture principals' daily records via separate submissions (check-in, daily activities, check-out) using server timestamps and automatically convert daily activities into weighted KPI points (total 100 points/day) for monitoring by Directors and Management without narrative reports.
architectural_notes: KPI scoring is activity-based with equal weights; total KPI per day must equal 100 points across the 6 defined activities.
Add three distinct submissions per day: check-in, daily activities, and check-out (stored as separate records/events).
All attendance (check-in/check-out) and activity submissions use server-side timestamps (timestamp at submit time).
Rename activity label 'QPC' to 'Qur’anic Parenting Center' without changing KPI scoring logic.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and a role model with exactly three roles: Principal (form-only), Director, and Management.

Create a Principal daily activity submission form that captures one day’s record containing the six required activities: Briefing, Classroom Supervision, Teacher Attendance Check, QPC, Weekly Liqo, Administration.
Automatically compute KPI points per submitted day with equal weights totaling 100 points/day across the six activities, and return computed KPI results alongside the stored record.
Create Director/Management monitoring screens that show KPI performance metrics (no narrative reports), including daily totals and per-activity breakdown, with filters for date range and Principal.
Apply a coherent visual theme across the app (colors, typography, layout) suitable for an education performance tracker; avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors.
Add a new Check-in submission feature that is stored separately from the existing Daily Activity submission, where the timestamp is generated on the backend (server time) at the moment of submission.

Add a new Check-out submission feature that is stored separately from the existing Daily Activity submission, where the timestamp is generated on the backend (server time) at the moment of submission.
Ensure the existing Daily Activity submission uses a backend-generated server timestamp, and update the QPC activity label to “Qur’anic Parenting Center” (no KPI/scoring logic changes).
Add navigation and routes so Principals can access three separate submission actions/pages: Check-in, Daily Activities, and Check-out, each with its own submit flow.

new_feature_requests.summary: Implement user roles & access: Kepsek (form-only input), Direktur, and Manajemen (monitoring views)
Daily activity input form for Kepsek with activities: briefing, supervisi kelas, cek kehadiran guru, QPC, liqo pekan, administrasi
Automatic KPI calculation: convert submitted activities into KPI points with equal weights totaling 100 points/day across activities
Director/Management monitoring dashboard to view daily KPI performance metrics without narrative reports

Persist daily activity records in the Motoko backend and expose query methods for (a) the submitting Principal to read their own submissions and (b) Director/Management to read submissions across Principals.
Add separate 'Absen Masuk' (check-in) submission feature with automatic server timestamp
Add separate 'Absen Keluar' (check-out) submission feature with automatic server timestamp
Revise daily activity label: change 'QPC' to 'Qur’anic Parenting Center' (no scoring logic change)
